subject: Photography
title: High Key and Low Key Lighting
description: Learn High Key and Low Key Lighting in one minute.

hook.text: A bright, airy portrait with minimal shadows. A dark, moody face with just a sliver of light. Two extremes.

buildup.text: High key uses predominantly bright tones. Low key uses predominantly dark tones. Both are deliberate choices.

discovery.text: High key feels cheerful, clean, and modern. Low key feels dramatic, mysterious, and powerful.

twist.text: Low key isn't just underexposure. It's careful placement of minimal light to reveal only what matters.

climax.text: The choice between high and low key is a storytelling decision, not a technical one.

quiz.question: What mood does low-key lighting typically create?
